content: yarn fingering-weight yarn in green red and small amount of black needles set of size 1 us 2 25mm double-pointed needles gauge gauge isn t important for this project yippee just make sure that your stitches are relatively tight which will help make your rose s stem sturdy note - the finished project is very small and is not suitable for small children - you can scale this pattern up with thicker yarn and bigger needles a list of pattern abbreviations can be found in the how-to section at mochimochiland com tiny rose by anna hrachovec mochimochiland com 1 stem/outside petals row 2 purl with green cast on 3 stitches onto one row 3 knit dpn row 4 purl knit 10 row of i-cord row 5 knit switch to red row 6 p2tog twice 2 sts round 11 worked as i-cord knit row 7 kfb twice 4 sts round 12 worked as i-cord kfb 3 times row 8 purl 6 sts row 9 knit divide the stitches onto 3 dpns to continue row 10 purl working in a round row 11 knit round 13 kfb 6 times 12 sts row 12 p2tog twice 2 sts round 14 kfb k1 6 times 18 sts break the yarn and draw it tightly through rnds 15-19 knit 5 rnds the stitches with a tapestry needle bind of the stitches purlwise finishing inside petals roll the inside petals piece into a loose with red cast on 12 stitches onto one dpn spiral with the knit stitches facing out insert to work flat the piece into the outside petals and stitch row 1 purl in place at the base of the cup shape row 2 k1 kfb k to end 13 sts row 3 purl attach the narrow section of the leaves to row 4 k1 kfb k to end 14 sts the back of the stem row 5 purl row 6 k1 kfb k to end 15 sts weave in the loose ends bind of the stitches knitwise on the purl side with black yarn embroider eyes onto one leaves side of the rose with 2 small horizontal stitches for each placing them 3 stitches with green cast on 2 stitches onto one dpn down from the bound-off edge and spacing to work flat them 3 stitches apart row 1 kfb twice 4 sts pin your rose on to wear proudly use it as a gift
